definition: to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]
to handle/to manage/to put in order/to arrange/to administer/to execute/to take action on/to plan
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: We must do something to stop the city noise.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须采取措施来控制城市噪音。

sentences.english: The government is taking measures to resettle those laid-off workers.
sentences.chinese: 政府正采取措施重新安顿那些失业工人。

sentences.english: Recruiting departments shall take measures to facilitate citizens' registration for examination.
sentences.chinese: 招录机关应当采取措施，便利公民报考。

sentences.english: Must adopting the measure of ecological control affectively.
sentences.chinese: 必须采取措施进行有效地治理与生态调控。

sentences.english: The Norwegian government is stepping in to reduce the nation's 40-percent divorce rate.
sentences.chinese: 挪威政府正采取措施降低本国40%的离婚率。

sentences.english: The government is taking measures to promote piscatorial development.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在采取措施促进渔业发展。

sentences.english: Are policy makers ready to do what it takes to break this vicious circle?
sentences.chinese: 决策者们准备采取措施打破这种恶性循环码？

sentences.english: It is urgent that just immedihpost measures should guarinitiing ould likeeedficevery one of they get to stop thesituine.
sentences.chinese: 很紧迫的是应随即采取措施阻止这一事态的发达。

sentences.english: The leisured man took no measure for the treasure in the treasury.
sentences.chinese: 那个悠闲的男子对金库里的财宝没有采取措施。

sentences.english: Board of Supervisors will consider "measures" such as badges of "garbage.
sentences.chinese: 董事会，监事会将考虑采取措施，如贴花的邓普斯特。

sentences.english: This warning is considered reviewable, but not necessarily actionable.
sentences.chinese: 应该检查警告，但是不一定要采取措施。

sentences.english: In a word we should take measures as soon as possible to forbiden these kind of behavior.
sentences.chinese: 总之，我们应该尽快采取措施来禁止这种行为。

sentences.english: I do think it's time that something should be done to protect our eye-sight.
sentences.chinese: 我真的认为是时候采取措施保护视力了。

sentences.english: He took measures to bring the disorders of king Stephen reign to an end.
sentences.chinese: 他采取措施结束了史蒂芬森国王统治时期的混乱局面。

sentences.english: Both of them have to take measures to deal with problmes caused by weak dollar.
sentences.chinese: 它们都需要采取措施来应对美元贬值引发的问题。

sentences.english: And we think that your factory needs to take measures to improve quality control.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为你们工厂需要采取措施来改善品管。

definition: to take action/to adopt policies/to move on some issue
to adopt or carry out (measures, policies, course of action)/to take
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
at the earliest possible time/as soon as possible
as quickly as possible/as soon as possible/with all speed
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
to curb/to put a stop to/to stop/to check/to limit
